# sampleCount

**Instance Property**

The sample count used to generate the [doc://com.apple.metalkit/documentation/MetalKit/MTKView/multisampleColorTexture] object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var sampleCount: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

Support for different sample count values varies by device object. Call the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/supportsTextureSampleCount(_:)] method to determine if the device object supports the sample count you want.

The default value is `1`. When you set a value greater than `1`, the view creates and configures an intermediate set of multisample textures. The pixel format is the same as the one specified for the drawable; see [doc://com.apple.metalkit/documentation/MetalKit/MTKView/colorPixelFormat]. When the view creates a render pass descriptor, the render pass uses those intermediate textures as the color render targets, with a store action to resolve these multisample textures into the drawable’s texture ([doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLStoreAction/multisampleResolve]).

## Configuring Multisampling

- **multisampleColorAttachmentTextureUsage**: The texture usage characteristics that the view uses when creating multisample textures.
